decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Beza, the Bounding Spring and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The player aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, then remove threats with cards like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse. The deck also utilizes powerful enchantments like High Noon and Path of Peril to maintain board control. Ultimately, the goal is to outlast the opponent and secure victory through a combination of control elements.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo between Greasefang and Parhelion II to create a powerful engine that generates value and control the game. The deck focuses on setting up the combo pieces while disrupting the opponent with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. Additionally, the deck includes various support cards like Monument to Endurance and Sheltered by Ghosts to protect the combo pieces and ensure its success. By efficiently managing resources and maintaining board presence, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through its unique combo strategy.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures and utilizing cards like Collected Company to quickly overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy. With a mix of efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, along with disruptive cards like Skyclave Apparition, the deck aims to maintain pressure on opponents while controlling the board. The inclusion of powerful threats like Archon of Emeria and Elspeth, Storm Slayer adds a strong finishing touch to ensure victory in the late game.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to utilize low-cost aggressive creatures with prowess triggers like Cori-Steel Cutter, Emberheart Challenger, and Soul-Scar Mage, along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Academic Dispute and Experimental Synthesizer to provide card advantage and maintain tempo. Den of the Bugbear and Monstrous Rage offer additional damage potential, while cards like Boomerang Basics and Stock Up provide flexibility and utility in various situations. Overall, the deck aims to win quickly by overwhelming the opponent with a combination of creature aggression and burn spells.

The deck focuses on control through a combination of powerful multicolor spells and versatile land cards. It utilizes Niv-Mizzet Reborn as a key card to draw more resources and answers to different situations. The deck also benefits from the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad, providing additional value and flexibility. The main strategy is to control the board with removal spells and Leyline Binding, while ramping up mana with cards like Up the Beanstalk. By combining efficient removal, card advantage, and versatile lands, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a longer game.

The deck focuses on creating a strong and efficient board presence by playing aggressive creatures like Bishop of Wings, Righteous Valkyrie, and Resplendent Angel. It aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a combination of powerful creatures and tempo plays like Collected Company and Skyclave Apparition. The inclusion of mana accelerants like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves allows for early plays and ramping into bigger threats. The deck also includes cards like Giada, Font of Hope and Kayla's Reconstruction to provide additional value and resilience. Ultimately, the goal is to apply consistent pressure and win the game swiftly.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressively by utilizing cheap and efficient spells and creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck focuses on cheap creature spells like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, paired with removal spells like Reckless Rage to maintain board control. The deck also includes cards like Monstrous Rage and Stormchaser's Talent to give the creatures additional power and evasion. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced aggressive strategy while maintaining tempo and pressure on the battlefield.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Emberheart Challenger to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes direct damage spells like Reckless Rage and Torch the Tower to control the board and clear the way for attacking. The inclusion of cards like Stormchaser's Talent and Monstrous Rage enhances the deck's ability to push damage through and maintain pressure. Additionally, the deck includes some card draw and mana fixing with Academic Dispute and Riverpyre Verge to ensure consistency in executing its game plan.

The main focus of this Orzhov Control deck is to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by leveraging its versatile removal options like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse, while also utilizing cards like Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's hand. The inclusion of powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Elenda, Saint of Dusk ensures the deck can close out games effectively once it has gained control.

The main strategy of this deck is to take advantage of powerful aggro creatures like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing efficient mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, the deck is able to ramp into powerful threats early on. Collected Company allows the player to dig for more creatures and maintain pressure on the opponent. Skyclave Apparition provides removal for troublesome permanents, while Elspeth, Storm Slayer offers a powerful finisher. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and maintain board presence to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly playing and maximizing green mana-producing creatures to enable powerful green devotion cards. By using cards like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic to ramp, the deck aims to flood the board with green mana symbols to power up cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Cavalier of Thorns. Storm the Festival helps dig for key threats, while Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner and Polukranos Reborn provide additional value and threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its mana acceleration and powerful green creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures. Utilizing powerful cards like Archon of Emeria and Collected Company, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Ouroboroid help to slow down the opponent, giving the deck an advantage in the early game. With a mix of ramp from Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, along with a variety of threats, the deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this Orzhov Control deck is to utilize disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the opponent's board while building up resources with cards like Castle Locthwain and Bleachbone Verge. The deck also incorporates powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and The Wandering Emperor to dominate the late game. With a mix of removal, card advantage, and threats, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a slower, more grindy match.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells. By using cards like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger, along with efficient removal spells like Reckless Rage and Torch the Tower, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish the game swiftly. The inclusion of cards like Academic Dispute and Stock Up helps to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure up throughout the game. The mana base is optimized to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors for spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and generating card advantage. It utilizes strong planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Elspeth, Storm Slayer to generate value and outlast the opponent. By managing the board with removal spells like Settle the Wreckage and Supreme Verdict, as well as utilizing card draw spells like Consult the Star Charts and Meticulous Archive, the deck aims to maintain control of the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing fast mana acceleration with Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic to quickly ramp into powerful threats like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition. Collected Company provides additional creature support, while Thalia, Guardian of Thraben disrupts opponent's spells. The inclusion of Aven Interrupter and Enduring Innocence helps maintain board control. The deck also includes some utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Branchloft Pathway, along with powerful creatures like Tyvar, the Pummeler and Ouroboroid. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells.
